title: Method and system for prioritizing cases for fraud detection
abstract: An approach provides detection of unauthorized use of data services. A fraud case is created for a data call that is determined to be potentially fraudulent based on a fraud alert. A fraud score is determined for the case according to the fraud alert. The fraud score is adjusted according to adjustment criteria including an intermediate network involved with the data call, and an originating country of the data call.
claims:
1. A method for supporting fraud detection, the method comprising:
creating a case for a data call that is determined to be potentially fraudulent based on a fraud alert;
determining a fraud score for the case according to the fraud alert; and
adjusting the fraud score according to adjustment criteria including an intermediate network involved with the data call, and an originating country of the data call.
2. A method according to claim 1, further comprising:
retrieving a first score adjustment factor corresponding to the intermediate network;
retrieving a second score adjustment factor corresponding to the originating country; and
outputting a modified fraud score by applying the score adjustment factors to the fraud score.
3. A method according to claim 1, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes number of users associated with a user identifier of the data call, the method further comprising:
retrieving a score adjustment factor corresponding to the number of users associated with the user identifier; and
applying the score adjustment factor to the fraud score.
4. A method according to claim 1, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes a sharing variable specifying whether sharing of the user identifier is permissible, the method further comprising:
retrieving a score adjustment factor if the sharing variable is set to not permit sharing; and
applying the score adjustment factor to the fraud score.
5. A method according to claim 1, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes whether a wireless connection is utilized to support the data call, the method further comprising:
retrieving a score adjustment factor corresponding to the wireless connection criterion; and
applying the score adjustment factor corresponding to the wireless connection criterion to the fraud score.
6. A method according to claim 1, wherein the intermediate network is operated by an intermediate service provider partnered with a primary service provider operating a primary network that authorized the data call.
7. A method according to claim 1, further comprising:
generating a plurality of cases including the created case;
outputting a plurality of adjusted fraud scores of the cases; and
ranking the cases according to the adjusted fraud scores.
8. A method according to claim 1, further comprising:
comparing the adjusted fraud score with a predetermined threshold; and
automatically initiating action if the predetermined threshold is satisfied.
9. A method according to claim 1, wherein the data call is a dial-up session.
10. A fraud detection system comprising:
a processor configured to create a case for a data call that is determined to be potentially fraudulent based on a fraud alert, and to determine a fraud score for the case according to the fraud alert,
wherein the fraud score is adjusted by the processor according to adjustment criteria including an intermediate network involved with the data call, and an originating country of the data call.
11. A system according to claim 10, further comprising:
a memory configured store a first score adjustment factor corresponding to the intermediate network and a second score adjustment factor corresponding to the originating country,
wherein the processor outputs a modified fraud score by applying the score adjustment factors to the fraud score.
12. A system according to claim 10, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes number of users associated with a user identifier of the data call, the system further comprising:
a memory configured to store a score adjustment factor corresponding to the number of users associated with the user identifier,
wherein the processor applies the score adjustment factor to the fraud score.
13. A system according to claim 10, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes number of users associated with a user identifier of the data call, the system further comprising:
a memory configured to store a score adjustment factor corresponding a sharing variable specifying whether sharing of the user identifier is permissible,
wherein the processor applies the score adjustment factor to the fraud score if the sharing variable is set to not permit sharing of the user identifier.
14. A system according to claim 10, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes whether a wireless connection is utilized to support the data call, the system further comprising:
a memory configured to store a score adjustment factor corresponding to the wireless connection criterion, wherein the processor applies the score adjustment factor corresponding to the wireless connection criterion to the fraud score.
15. A system according to claim 10, wherein the intermediate network is operated by an intermediate service provider partnered with a primary service provider operating a primary network that authorized the data call.
16. A system according to claim 10, wherein a plurality of cases include the created case are generated, the processor outputting a plurality of adjusted fraud scores corresponding to the cases and ranking the cases according to the adjusted fraud scores.
17. A system according to claim 10, wherein the adjusted fraud score is compared with a predetermined threshold for automatically initiating action if the predetermined threshold is satisfied.
18. A system according to claim 10, wherein the data call is a dial-up session.
19. A method for supporting fraud detection, the method comprising:
creating a plurality of fraud cases, each fraud case specifying a remote access connection for data services that generated a fraud alert;
assigning each of the fraud cases an initial fraud score;
adjusting each of the fraud score according to adjustment criteria including an intermediate network supporting the corresponding remote access connection, and an originating country of the corresponding remote access connection; and
prioritizing the fraud cases based on the adjusted fraud scores.
20. A method according to claim 19, wherein the initial fraud scores are assigned according to the corresponding fraud alerts.
21. A method according to claim 19, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes determining whether the remote access connection involves a wireless connection, the method further comprising:
retrieving a first score adjustment factor corresponding to the intermediate network;
retrieving a second score adjustment factor corresponding to the originating country;
retrieving a third score adjustment factor corresponding to the number of users associated with the user identifier; and
retrieving a fourth score adjustment factor corresponding to the wireless connection criterion,
wherein the score adjustment factors are used to adjust corresponding ones of the fraud scores.
22. A method according to claim 19, wherein the intermediate network is operated by an intermediate service provider partnered with a primary service provider operating a primary network that initiated establishment of the remote access connection.
23. A method according to claim 19, wherein the remote access connection is a dial-up session.
24. A system for supporting fraud detection, the system comprising:
means for creating a plurality of fraud cases, each fraud case specifying a remote access connection for data services that generated a fraud alert;
means for assigning each of the fraud cases an initial fraud score;
means for adjusting each of the fraud score according to adjustment criteria including an intermediate network supporting the corresponding remote access connection, and an originating country of the corresponding remote access connection; and
means for prioritizing the fraud cases based on the adjusted fraud scores.
25. A system according to claim 24, wherein the adjustment criteria further includes determining whether the remote access connection involves a wireless connection, the system further comprising:
a memory configured to store a plurality of score adjustment factors corresponding, respectively, to the intermediate network, the originating country, the number of users associated with the user identifier, and the wireless connection criterion,
wherein the score adjustment factors are used to adjust corresponding ones of the fraud scores.
